title: Rebecca Judd reveals she would want husband Chris to find love and remarry if she died
text:
Rebecca Judd tied the knot with AFL star Chris nine years ago.

But the 36-year-old beauty has revealed that if she died, she would want her husband to find love and remarry.

Talking on her KIIS FM radio show, the 3pm Pickup, Rebecca said: 'I'd want him to be happy.'

The happy couple! AFL couple Rebecca and Chris Judd (pictured) have been married for nine years after tying the knot in 2010

She made the comment while talking about Hollywood actress Mila Kunis who said she would be happy for her husband Ashton Kutcher to remarry in the event of her death.

Turning the conversation to Rebecca, the show's co-host Katie 'Monty' Dimond asked: 'If you dropped dead would you want Juddy [Chris Judd], your husband, to find someone else?'

Without hesitation, Rebecca replied: 'Yeah I'd want him to be happy, for sure. Would you want your [Katie's] partner Sam?'

Revealing: Talking on her KIIS FM radio show, the 3pm Pickup , Rebecca said: 'I'd want Chris to be happy'

Katie joked she doesn't trust her hubby's judgement, and said: 'I wouldn't want him to find someone for quite a while.'

American actress Mila Kunis was being interviewed for a podcast in the States when she made the intriguing revelation.

She even went as far as to say she would be happy for Ashton to move on with her mother.

Stunner: Rebecca Judd (pictured revealed that if she died, she would want her husband to find love and remarry

Rebecca wed retired AFL captain Chris, 36, in 2010, and the couple share four children, son Oscar, eight, daughter Billie, five, and twin sons Tom and Darcy, three.

In December last year, Rebecca shared a black and white photo of herself and Chris in their family home, to Instagram to mark their eighth wedding anniversary.

'Eight years married today. 15 years together. Four kids later. And a double shot lattè in bed every morning. Lucky me,' the Jaggad co-founder captioned the shot.

description: Rebecca Judd (pictured with husband Chris) has revealed that if she died, she would want Chris to find love and remarry.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
